Heading:
Shoaib Akhtar cracks rain joke ahead of India-Pakistan matchICC Cricket World Cup 2019: With rain expected to interrupt Sunday's
big-ticket clash between India and Pakistan in Manchester, former Pakistan
pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to social media to crack a rain joke.

Mohammad Yousuf slams PCB for allowing families to stay with players ahead of India clashPakistani players have been joined by their wives and children them ahead of
the most anticipated clash against India on June 16.

India vs Pakistan weather forecast news update: World Cup 2019 Manchester Old TraffordIndia vs Pakistan World Cup 2019 weather forecast news update: Rain threat
looms over the big-ticket match between India and Pakistan at Old Trafford in
Manchester on Sunday.

Karachi-born fan grateful to Dhoni for IND-PAK ticketsICC Cricket World Cup 2019: Karachi-born Pakistan fan, Mohammad Bashir aka
Chacha Chicago has been getting match tickets for India-Pakistan clashes
from MS Dhoni since 2011. Bashir revealed that he doesn't call Dhoni anymore
but keeps in touch with him via text messages.

World Cup 2019: India vs Pakistan match tickets being resold for upto Rs 60,000The tickets for India vs Pakistan World Cup 2019 match in Old Trafford was
sold out withing hours of ticket window opening but a few who had bought
tickets are earning more by reselling them.

David Warner will be the top run-scorer of World Cup 2019, says Ricky PontingAustralia had a stunning win against Pakistan in which David Warner scored a
knock of 107 off 109 balls. Warner managed to play better after he took his
hand-brake off and lead Australia to an applaud-worthy win.

World Cup 2019: We can't copy teams like India, says Dimuth KarunaratneSri Lanka skipper Dimuth Karunaratne said that Sri Lanka can't compare
themselves with their northern neighbours in the race to the semi-finals of
the World Cup 2019

De Villiers should've planned his World Cup 2019 comeback better: Dussen Rassie van der Dussen, who replaced AB de Villiers in the South Africa World
Cup squad, believes the retired batsman should have handled his World Cup
2019 comeback plan in a better way.

World Cup 2019: India vs Pakistan all about absorbing pressure, says Sachin TendulkarWorld Cup 2019: Battig great Sachin Tendulkar, speaking to India Today, said
India batsmen must be willing enough to play out good spells from Pakistan
pacers and respect such situations during the much-anticipated India-Pakistan
clash on Sunday in Manchester.

World Cup 2019: Why India are outright favourites against PakistanIndia vs Pakistan World Cup 2019: Never mind what Pakistan say. They will
find it very, very difficult when they take on India on Sunday. For all facts
and purposes, Virat Kohli's team is much stronger and India are overwhelming
favourites against Pakistan.

World Cup 2019: No way Pakistan can beat India, says Virender SehwagAs India and Pakistan gear up for their World Cup 2019 face-off in Manchester
on June 16, former Indian opener Virender Sehwag has thrown his weight behind
Virat Kohli and Co. saying that he has no doubt that India will beat their
arch-rivals
ENG vs WI Live Score, World Cup 2019 Updates: Woakes falls but England close in on win

Sachin Tendulkar sues Australian cricket bat maker for using his nameIndia legendary batsman Sachin Tendulkar has sued an Australia bat
manufacturer for using his name and image to promote their products.

India to begin World Test Championship vs West Indies in Antigua on August 22 India will begin their World Test Championship campaign against the West
Indies in August in Antigua. The Asian giants will play the first 2 matches
of a 3-match T20I series in Florida. The tour will also include a 3-match ODI
series.

Amir opened up on spot-fixing after Afridi slapped him: RazzaqICC had banned all three players—Salman Butt for ten years, of which five
were suspended, Muhammad Asif for seven years, of which two were suspended,
and Muhammad Amir for five years, after spot-fixing charges were proved
during investigation.

Yuvraj Singh deserves a proper farewell: Kapil DevKapil Dev said that a player of Yuvraj's stature deserves farewell from the
ground. Yuvraj announced his retirement from international cricket on Monday.

Jemimah Rodrigues to play England's Kia Super LeagueIndia's young women's cricket star Jemimah Rodrigues will become the third
player from the country after Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur to feature
in the T20 competition in England.

Virat Kohli only Indian in Forbes 2019 list of world's highest-paid athletesVirat Kohli, who was ranked 83rd in Forbes 2018 list of highest-paid
athletes, has been placed at the 100th spot in the recently-updated list
which is headed by Barcelona superstar Lionel Messi.

21:04Shikhar Dhawan injury big blow to India: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh spoke to India Today after Shikhar Dhawan was ruled out of
World Cup 2019 for 3 weeks with a fractured thumb. Harbhajan told that
Shikhar Dhawan's injury is a big blow to India in World Cup 2019.
"Well, it could be 3 weeks depending on how bad the injury is. They are
actually assuming. In the end, it will come down to how Shikhar Dhawan will
feel batting with the injured finger. Even if the injury heals, it will
depend on him to get fully fit." added Harbhajan.

Yuvraj Singh to Shoaib Akhtar: It was terrifying to face youA day after announcing his retirement from international cricket, Yuvraj
Singh thanked long-time rival Shoaib Akhtar for his tribute on social media

Does Yuvraj Singh deserve a farewell match? Here is Sourav Ganguly's takeSourav Ganguly on Tuesday said he doesn't believe in farewell matches when
responding to a fan's question on whether Yuvraj Singh deserved a retirement
match. Yuvraj announced his retirement from international cricket on Monday.

#YuviDeservesProperFarewell trending on Twitter after Yuvraj Singh retirementYuvraj Singh said he had turned down an offer to play a retirement match but
his fans want him to get a proper farewell a day after the legend announced
his retirement from international cricket and the Indian Premier League.
07:32World Cup 2019: Big blow to Team India as Shikhar Dhawan is ruled out

Afridi, Akhtar pay tribute to retired Yuvraj: We spent great time togetherYuvraj Singh ended his international career with an outstanding ODI record of
8701 runs -- 22nd in the overall list, and seventh among Indians -- at an
average of 36.55 and 111 wickets.

Eden Hazard fuels 'Galacticos' expectations at Real MadridEden Hazard's arrival at Real Madrid has made the fans dream once again of a
'Galacticos' team. The original Galacticos team included football's greatest
players like Zinedine Zidane, Ronaldo, Luis Figo, David Beckham and others
who played until the summer of 2005.

Let me announce my retirement when the moment comes: Iker CasillasIker Casillas had suffered a heart attack during a training session with his
current team, FC Porto, casting major doubt about his ability to continue in
the sport.

UEFA launches online streaming portal, aims for young fansUEFA’s new streaming portal will show highlights of weekend matches in the
Bundesliga in TV markets including Britain, Italy, Russia, Spain, the Middle
East and Africa.

EPL 2019/20 fixtures out: Manchester United v Chelsea tops opening gamesNew Premier League season will begin on Friday, August 9th one week after the
Community Shield final between Manchester City and Liverpool at Wembley.

Manchester United complete Welsh winger James signingJames had joined Hull City in 2014 before moving to Swansea. The Welsh winger
had scored 5 goals in 38 matches for Swansea last season.

Euro 2020 qualifiers: France bounce back, Belgium and Germany win bigTheir third victory in as many matches lifted Germany to nine points while
world champions France cruised to a 4-0 against Andorra and reclaimed first
place in Group H.

Filipe Luis to decide future after Copa AmericaFilipe Luis will decide his future between teams in Europe and Brazil, after
the Copa America. Luis' contract with Atletico Madrid expires on June 30 and
has been in touch with Barcelona and Flamengo, but he has not ruled out
remaining at Atletico Madrid.

Copa America: Neymar's absence could be blessing in disguise for hosts BrazilNeymar suffered the ankle injury during Brazil's 2-0 friendly win over Qatar
and he won't be able to recover in time for their Copa America campaign.

Neymar wants controversial Santos-Barca transfer trial to be held in BarcelonaTrial for alleged fraud and corruption over, 2013 Santos-Barcelona transfer
deal be moved to the Spanish city, Neymar and his parents requested,
prosecutor opposed.

Portugal clinch UEFA Nations League title after 1-0 win over NetherlandsGoncalo Guedes scored the lone goal of the match in the 60th minute to fire
Portugal to a 1-0 win over Netherlands.

U-20 World Cup: Ecuador, S Korea book semi-final berth Ukraine will take on Italy in Gdynia, and Ecuador will face South Korea in
Lublin, in the semi-finals of Under-20 football World Cup on June 11.

Neymar does not need surgery on injured right ankle: PSGParis Saint-Germain has issued a statement saying their star footballer
Neymar, who has been ruled out of the upcoming Copa America tournament due to
an injury, would not be needing surgery on his ankle.

Dominic Thiem extends olive branch to Serena Williams with mixed doubles offerDominic Thiem was left fuming after being asked to make way for Serena
Williams at a post-match news conference following her third-round defeat in
the first week of the French Open last month.

Maria Sharapova to return to action at Mallorca OpenFormer world No.1 Maria Sharapova, who has not played since her withdrawal
from a second-round match at the WTA St Petersburg Ladies Trophy, will make a
return at Mallorca Open.

French Open 2019: Rafael Nadal beats Dominic Thiem to clinch 12th title at Roland GarrosRafael Nadal won 6-3, 5-7, 6-1, 6-1 against the fourth-seeded Austrian and is
now only two grand slam titles behind Roger Federer's record of 20.
French Open 2019 Men's Singles Final Highlights: Rafael Nadal wins record-extending 12th title

Rafael Nadal vs Dominic Thiem Live Streaming: French Open 2019 Final BroadcastIt is a contest between Dominic Thiem, who is aiming to win his maiden major
crown and Rafael Nadal, who is a 17-time Grand Slam champion and is bidding
for a record-extending French Open title. It is a repeat of the 2018 final on
June 9 in Paris.

Marketa Vondrousova will be new face of Czech tennis, says Hana MandlikovaAccording to Hana Mandlikova, a 1981 Roland Garros champion, Marketa
Vondrousova's pursuit to become the first Czech woman to win the French Open
fell short but the 19-year-old is destined to win a Grand Slam title.
Mandlikova was also 19 when she claimed the French Open.

Ashleigh Barty: The cricket star who went on to become French Open 2019 championAshleigh Barty, who came in the French Open seeded eighth, became the first
Australian in 46 years to lift the women's trophy at Roland Garros.

I played the perfect match: Ashleigh Barty after French Open 2019 triumphAfter ditching tennis for cricket for a year, Ashleigh Barty made a great
come back by smashing Marketa Vondrousova for six to lift the French Open
crown. This is Barty's first Grand Slam title and Australia's first French
women’s singles crown in more than four decades.

French Open 2019: Ashleigh Barty clinches historic Roland Garros title in one-sided finalAshleigh Barty, who had played Women's Big Bash League before returning to
tennis in 2016, became the first Australian player in 46 years to win the
women's singles title at French Open.

French Open 2019: Dominic Thiem ends Novak Djokovic streak to reach finalFrench Open 2019: In a rain interrupted men's singles semi-final, Dominic
Thiem defeated Novak Djokovic in 5 sets to face Rafael Nadal in the final on
Sunday.
French Open women's singles final Highlights: Ashleigh Barty wins maiden Grand Slam singles title

French Open 2019: Djokovic, Thiem resume semifinal, women's final followsNovak Djokovic and Dominic Thiem have split the first two sets, then Thiem
went up by a break in the third, before play was halted Friday due to rain.
They're scheduled to resume in Court Philippe Chatrier on Saturday.

Malaysian badminton icon Lee Chong Wei announces retirement after cancer battleThree-time Olympic medallist Lee Chong Wei has announced retirement after 19
years of stellar badminton career following his battle with nose cancer.

PV Sindhu, Sameer Verma lose in dismal day for India at Australian OpenPV Sindhu's struggles on the tour this season continues as she was knocked
out in the second round of Australian Open 2019 after a straight-game loss to
lower-ranked Nitchaon Jindapol on Thursday.

Sindhu, Sameer make impressive starts at Australian OpenP V Sindhu and Sameer Verma progressing to the second round of the Australian
Open World Tour Super 300 tournament. The Indian will meet experienced Thai
Nitchaon Jindapol next.

Sudirman Cup: Kento Momota stunned as China cruise to 11th titleWorld No. 1 men's singles shuttler Kento Momota suffered his first defeat in
a team event at the senior level as Shi Yuqi led China to their
record-extending 11th Sudirman Cup title on Sunday.

Himanta Biswa Sarma elected as vice president of Badminton Asia CouncilAssam's health and education minister Himanta Biswa Sarma was last year
unanimously elected the Badminton Association of India president.

China thrash Thailand 3-0, reach Sudirman Cup finalTen-time winners China beat Thailand 3-0 to qualify for their 13th straight
Sudirman Cup final. China will play the final against the winner between
Japan and Indonesia.

Pullela Gopichand blames hectic calendar for shuttlers' poor run in 2019The slump in form for the major badminton stars of India comes at a rather
awkward time with the 2020 Tokyo Olympics around the corner.

Sudirman Cup: Japan beat Malaysia to advance to last 4Japan put an all-round performance to defeat defeated Malaysia 3-0 to qualify
for the first semi-finals of the ongoing Sudirman Cup in China

Sudirman Cup: Denmark beat Indonesia, both advance to last 8 Sudirman Cup: Denmark defeated Indonesia 3-2 in the pre-quarters, however,
the latter remained the group topper despite the loss as both the teams
advanced to the last 8 of the tournament.

India knocked out of Sudirman Cup after 0-5 loss to ChinaAfter going down 2-3 to Malaysia in their opening Group 1D match, India
needed an extraordinary effort to get across the mighty Chinese but the
shuttlers yet again produced a below-par performance to go down in a
lop-sided contest

Sudirman Cup: PV Sindhu's heroics in vain as Malaysia beat India 3-2 India's decision to field world no. 13 Sameer Verma instead of Kidambi
Srikanth in men's singles backfired as a young Malaysian contingent consigned
them to a 3-2 defeat despite PV Sindhu winning her own match

Sudirman Cup: India shuttlers take on Malaysia, eye knockout stageSudirman Cup: India have reached the quarterfinals twice in the 2011 and 2017
editions but haven't crossed the last eight stage.

Dutee Chand warns followers against fake Twitter accounts using her nameDutee Chand's troubles don't seem to end as while battling her family and the
society at large due to her sexual orientation, she is now having to fight
out fake Twitter accounts in her own name

Another athlete slams testosterone rules, refuses medicationOlympic medalist Margaret Wambui criticized the IAAF's testosterone
regulations and said she won't take "any type of medication" to lower her
natural testosterone.

I'm so proud of Dutee Chand: Ellen DeGeneres on Indian sprinter's coming outPopular host Ellen DeGeneres rejoiced and was proud of the fact that Dutee
Chand became the 1st sportperson in India to openly admit that she's gay. The
100m record holder and winner of two Asian Games silver medals had recently
opened up to the media about her homosexuality.

Asian Championships winner Gomathi fails dope test, faces provisional suspensionAsian Championships 800 metres gold medallist Gomathi Marimuthu was tested
positive for a banned substance. Gomathi will face a 4-year suspension if her
B sample also tests positive.

Sister's blackmail, torture forced me to reveal my same-sex relationship: Dutee ChandIndia's fastest woman Dutee Chand has said that she revealed about her
same-sex relationship after being tortured by her eldest sister.

Dutee Chand faces family's wrath after revealing same-sex relationshipDutee Chand said that her eldest sister threatened to not only expel her from
the family but also send her to jail.

Ace sprinter Dutee Chand reveals she is in same-sex relationship with 'soulmate'Dutee Chand revealed in an interview that she is in a same-sex relationship
with a girl from her hometown.

Neeraj Chopra recovering without complications: AFI presidentNeeraj Chopra may miss the Doha World Championships as his recovery is likely
to take at least three months after he had arthroscopic surgery on his
throwing right hand to remove bone fragments from his elbow joint.

South African government to appeal against Caster Semenya rulingMiddle-distance runner Caster Semenya had lost a crucial case after the Court
of Arbitration for Sport ruled that female track athletes with naturally high
levels of testosterone have to regulate their hormone levels to participate
in major events, including the Olympics.

Russian athlete Savina gets 12-year banA ban as long as 12 years is uncommon but Russian athelete Kseniya Savina
attempted to shift blame and avoid sanctions by providing false medical
documents added another anti-doping rule violation in her case.

I can qualify for 2020 Tokyo Olympics: Jinson JohnsonJinson Johnson feels he can qualify for the 1500 metres event at the 2020
Tokyo Olympics, despite his recent injury concerns.

Hell no: Defiant Caster Semenya wins, says she won't take drugsCaster Semenya won the 800 meters at the opening Diamond League meeting of
the season in Doha and it was her first win since losing her case against the
IAAF.

FIH Series 2019: Poland & Russia arrive in Bhubaneshwar India will open their campaign against Russia on June 6 and meet Poland on
June 7 and Uzbekistan on June 10 in their remaining pool matches. The final
of the tournament will be played on June 15.

Indian women's hockey team end series with 0-4 loss to South Korea After two back-to-back wins, Indian women's hockey team lost 0-4 to South
Korea in the third and final game of the series.

India take unassailable 2-0 lead over Korea, clinch women's hockey seriesHigh on confidence after their impressive outings in Spain and Malaysia
earlier this year, India had won the opening game with identical margin.

Indian women's hockey team beat South Korea 2-1 in tour openerHigh on confidence after their impressive outings in Spain and Malaysia
earlier this year, India made a strong start against hosts South Korea

Hockey: Need to score consistently under tight marking, says Graham ReidIndia lost both the matches against Australia on their tour Down Under after
performing well against Australia A and WA Thundersticks.

Rani Rampal sees Korea series as platform to prepare for FIH Women's series FinalsIndia women's hockey team captain Rani Rampal is looking forward to doing
well in the three-match series against Korea in the run-up to the FIH Women's
series Finals.

India end Australia tour with loss in the final matchIndia lost the fifth and final match by 5-2 against Australia to end their
tour on a sour note. Nilakanta Sharma and Rupinderpal Singh scored the two
goals for India.

India succumb to 0-4 loss against Australia in first hockey testAustralia rode on two goals each from Jeremy Hayward and Blake Govers to
outclass India in the first match of the two-test series at the Perth Hockey
Stadium on Wednesday.

Indian men's hockey team draws 1-1 with Australia AHarmanpreet Singh helped the Indian men's hockey team salvage a 1-1 draw
against Australia 'A' on Monday.

Indian men's hockey team wins 3-0 against Australia AThe Indian men's Hockey team registered a comfortable 3-0 victory against
Australia A on Friday. India will play their next match on May 13.

Playing Australia will boost our confidence, says India hockey captain Manpreet SinghThe India team travel Down Under for five matches starting Wednesday. The
tour, marked as a preparation for next month's Hockey Series Final will be
newly-appointed chief coach Graham Reid's maiden assignment with the team.

Manpreet Singh to lead India in tour of AustraliaManpreet Singh will lead a balanced 18-man squad in the four-match tour
against Australia which starts May 10. India men's hockey team head coach
Graham Reid also spoke of the importance of the tour ahead of the FIH Men's
Hockey Series Final.

Want to retire after Tokyo Olympics, says Mary KomSix-time World Champion, Mary Kom said she wants to retire from the game
after winning a gold medal for the country at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.

Vijender Singh is scared of me: British boxer Amir KhanAmir Khan, a celebrated boxer, bragged saying Vijender Singh is "scared" of
me. Khan, the British boxer, has expressed a desire to wrangle with Olympic
bronze medalist Vijender a number of times but the same has not been
materialized yet.

India sweep mixed team titles to conclude best ever ISSF WC performanceIndia produced their best performance with a total of 5 gold and a silver
medal, to top the medals tally at the ISSF World Cup in Munich.

Munich World Cup: Manu Bhaker secures Olympic quota in shootingIndian shooters are competing for 12 of the 17 Tokyo Olympic quotas available
in Munich, having already secured seven quota places in rifle and pistol
competitions.

ISSF Shooting World Cup: Saurabh Chaudhary smashes world record to put India on topA world-record shattering performance from young shooter Saurabh Chaudhary
combined with Rahi Sarnobat's gold medal put India on top of the medals tally
of the ISSF World Cup in Munich

ISSF Shooting World Cup: Apurvi Chandela bags 10m air rifle gold in MunichApurvi Chandela had also won silver in the 10m air rifle during the 2015
Munich competition. Chandela had won quotas for the 2020 Olympics after
finishing fourth at the world championships.

Nike to waive performance targets for pregnant athletesSportswear giant Nike will be waiving performance-pay reductions for 12
months for athletes who are pregnant or already have a baby after 2 athletes
confirmed that Nike had frozen their sponsorship payments while they were
pregnant.

Boxing league likely to happen in August or September: BFI president Ajay SinghBoxing league is likely to happen this year in August or September as 'decent
amount of work is happening', Ajay Singh, President of Boxing Federation of
India, said. It is trying to find a slot to see that the league does not
clash with any other major leagues.

India Open Boxing: Mary, Sarita lead hosts' gold rush on final dayOlympic bronze medallist Mary Kom saw off a valiant fight by former national
champion Vanlal Duati of Mizoram to emerge winner by unanimous decision

Indian Open Boxing: Mary Kom feels disrespected with opponent Nikhat Zareen's challenge Boxing legend Mary Kom was furious with Nikhat Zareen's comments on
challenging her and asked her to prove herself in the ring first rather than
making such 'irritating' comments.

Dipa Karmakar will return to gymnastics only when fully fit: CoachWith Dipa Karmakar's participation uncertain at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics,
coach Bisweswar Nandi said the gymnast was doing everything possible to
return as soon as possible after a knee injury.

IOC recommends boxing to remain Olympic sport at TokyoInternational Olympic Committee’s (IOC) recommended boxing keeps its place
at next year’s Olympic Games but AIBA, the governing body of the sport’s
amateur version, should be suspended.
